topic: How to document stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Stream Processing Documentation Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: Learn how to document stream processing functionality using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+, including setting up routes, handling data streams, and adding documentation.
key_points: Utilize FastAPI's powerful features for building APIs in Python
Support for streaming data via websockets or HTTP/Streaming API
Properly document routes, parameters, and responses to improve API usability
Implement middleware for processing incoming and outgoing streams of data

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()

@app.websocket/
async def websocket_stream(websocket: WebSocket):
    await websocket.send_text('Welcome to the stream processing API!')

from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware

app = FastAPI()

origins = ['*']

app.add_middleware(CORSMiddleware, allow_origins=origins)

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for utilizing the features and improvements added in the latest version of Python.
FastAPI v0.68.0 or later is recommended for using streaming functionality, though earlier versions may also work.
caveats: Ensure your webserver supports WebSockets if you're planning to use them for real-time stream processing.
Be aware of potential performance and scalability trade-offs when handling large amounts of streaming data.
Test thoroughly and monitor performance to optimize your stream processing API as needed.
